newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH BANK CZK 52MLN Q1 97 GROSS PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: CZECH BANK CZK 52MLN Q1 97 GROSS PROFIT.

text.p: Czech bank Zivnostenska Banka a.s. gross profit dipped to 52 million crowns in the first quarter of this year from a net first quarter profit of 121 million in the previous year, according to filings with the Prague Stock Exchange.
Results for three months ending March 31, 1997, according
to Czech accounting standards (in millions of crowns):
NOTE: Germany's BHF-Bank AG holds a 47 percent
stake in Zivnostenska Banka. The International Finance
Corporation holds a 10 percent stake. Zivnostenska shares are
traded on the main market of the Prague Stock Exchange.
